channel.title: When disaster strikes
channel.description:
This series focuses on disaster preparation, as well as the effects wrought by disaster.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Who's in charge here?
item.description: Problems of command and direction. Dilemmas of control and coordination. Sources of leadership. How disaster affects customary controls and authorities.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Tornado damage

item.title: With best intentions
item.description: The compelling urge to help. Willing workers as hindrances to vital work. Important aspects of volunteer goods and services.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Rescues

item.title: Someone to lean on
item.description: Impact of disaster on family groups. Behavior and attitudes of family members. Significant reactions to disaster, to the problems posed by disaster, and to the threat of future danger.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Tornado damage

item.title: Who's in charge here?
item.description: Problems of command and direction. Dilemmas of control and coordination. Sources of leadership. How disaster affects customary controls and authorities.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Tornado damage

item.title: Someone to lean on
item.description: Impact of disaster on family groups. Behavior and attitudes of family members. Significant reactions to disaster, to the problems posed by disaster, and to the threat of future danger.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Tornado damage

item.title: With best intentions
item.description: The compelling urge to help. Willing workers as hindrances to vital work. Important aspects of volunteer goods and services.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Rescues

item.title: You can't always tell!
item.description: Problems of communication and problems arising from lack of communication. Obstacles in the process of sharing vital information. Difficulties in telling and being told.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Emergency communication systems.

item.title: Out of this rubble
item.description: The progressive stages of disaster reaction. Differing mental and emotional outlooks and when they imply for survival and rehabilitation of individuals, of families, of the community.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Disasters

item.title: Rehearsal for disaster
item.description: This program envisions how a "Rehearsal for Disaster" can point out the strengths and weaknesses in a community's emergency plan.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Disasters--United States.

item.title: Rehearsal for disaster
item.description: This program envisions how a "Rehearsal for Disaster" can point out the strengths and weaknesses in a community's emergency plan.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Disasters--United States.

item.title: Operation repeat
item.description: This program focuses on San Angelo, Texas, the site of a 1953 tornado and a major 1954 storm. Aspects of adjustment and rehabilitation after the first crisis. what happens to people when "lightning strikes twice."
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Tornado damage

item.title: You can't always tell!
item.description: Problems of communication and problems arising from lack of communication. Obstacles in the process of sharing vital information. Difficulties in telling and being told.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R. C.
item.dc:subject: Emergency communication systems.
